attributes.action: Legalise the possesion and use of tasers within the security industry.
attributes.background: In the security industry there are certain situations where security staff are unable protect themselves, Innocent bystanders, Assets. Due to individuals being agressive who cant be controlled by using conventional methods or a indavidual with a weapon, Bladed article or a possible firearm etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Each year there is numerous deaths and assaults within the security industry, Which could of been avoided with the use of a taser.

We understand that the use of a taser would be the very last resort. However we believe tasers would prevent such agression just by being a visual deterrent.
Monitoring tasers:
Anyone possesing a taser would need adequate training.
Body cameras to be used in conjuction with tasers to show taser was correctly drawn/used.

Police are the front line but so are we.

attributes.action: Special funding to Councils for social housing for adults with disabilities
attributes.background: Many local authorities have social housing problems... but more so for adults with physical disabilities and/or learning disabilities (who may require shared living). Where housing associations have stepped in to provide properties they charge rents far beyond what is affordable on housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details: Many social housing properties are in disadvantaged areas with high crime, making them unsafe for many adults with learning disabilities, or properties are ill suited for the person's physical disabilities... this results in many people having to continue living wth parents long into adulthood... with complex care needs that place unsustainable pressure on the family relationship increasing the risk of crisis or carer breakdown.

attributes.action: Reduce the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the same level as Scotland
attributes.background: In 2014 an estimated 240 people were killed in Great Britain in accidents where at least one driver was over the legal limit. Drinking and driving increases the risk of a crash and the likelihood that death or serious injury will occur. Reducing the limit will save lives and make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: In December 2014 the Scottish Executive introduced The Road Traffic Act 1988 (Prescribed Limit) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 which reduced the legal alcohol limit for drivers to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood. The limit in England and Wales is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. Bringing the limit in England and Wales in line with the limit in Scotland would be very beneficial as it would reduce accidents, preventing serious injury and death.

attributes.action: Increase British military support in protecting endangered animals in Africa.
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of endangered animals in Africa are being poached every year throughout the continent. Many of the countries where this poaching is most common are very limited on resources that is needed to protect these animals. The British military would have the resources to make a impact.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Bring back a discounted fee for regular users of the dartford crossing! DART-TAG
attributes.background: The discounted price of £1.67 is not good enough! As an everyday user I now pay roughly £1219.10 a year in crossings, living 10 mins away in erith! Whereas a few roads away in dartford people have the option to pay a £20 yearly fee! This is appalling - there's needs to be support for everyday users.
attributes.additional_details:
The previous dat tag gave the option of discounted prices, not only for local residents but commuters and regular users.

There is no support for those crossing everyday, they are instead paying out Thousands a year, when those locally have the option of a £20 annual fee.

The payments should have been scrapped once the cost of building was settled.

The Dartford Crossing is raking in £3MILLION per week in fines alone as people can not afford this upkeep on top of their cost of living!

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: Investigate the standard of care provided by local CFS ME services in the uk.
attributes.background: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) / myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a debilitating disease that causes many symptoms including severe fatigue. The quality of care appears to be perticually poor in the uk, especially in rural counties, with some services acting outside of nice guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience with my local CFS service has been extremely poor, I was 16 when diagnosed and until I was 18 I was seen 3 times be a children's OT. All that my local CFS service offers is an initial information session (the information was mostly wrong), an initial assessment and a 6 week managing life styles group, this is completely contradictory to the NICE guideline. And they do not offer CBT or GET, 2 of the 3 treatments recommended by NICE. This is not the only service like this!

attributes.action: Permanently move Parliament to a more UK population central location.
attributes.background: The seat of power in the UK has for too long resided in a place inaccessible to most of the country. This has resulted in generations of regional underinvestment and the revenue creation capacity of our country massively skewed to financial services in the City, Greater London and the South East
attributes.additional_details: With a new parliament location a more commutable distance, we can also do away with the cost of many second homes for MPs. The £40+Billion cost of HS2 can be reallocated to pay for a new Parliament building (The final cost of Holyrood was put at £414M) and the renewal of the rail infrastructure to support it. After hundreds of years of revenue flowing from the rest of the UK to the South East, it’s about time it started seeding sustainable growth elsewhere.

attributes.action: Enable Police and Telephone services to trace and prosecute cold callers.
attributes.background: Cold calling is supposed to be illegal, TPS is not a deterrent, so the Police, trading Standards and Telephone service providers should be compelled to cooperate to trace, arrest, and prosecute offenders. A help line should be created for reporting offending numbers.
attributes.additional_details: In this digital world, it should be possible to trace who purchased any number. Citizens can bar withheld numbers to prevent some calls, but there is a problem with normal numbers. These must be held on record by service providers. They must be traceable to a specific location.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Stop doctors striking and withdrawing emergency care
attributes.background: We ask that the government make it illegal for people who work within the medical profession to withdraw from work and strike for more than 24 hours consecutively.   We also request that anyone doing so be struck off for intentionally causing distress and refusing to treat patients

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: To reduce fraud, Banks must match Name to the A/C No. before Auth. transactions!
attributes.background: Currently UK banks only check if the sort code and account number is correct before a transaction is authorised. This opens vulnerabilities for fraudsters to exploit the system. In some other countries, if the name does not match the account then the transaction is rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must make this a statutory requirement.

Example case: 
MARY has building work done by JOHN. JOHN's email is compromised by fraudsters who send MARY payment request to be paid into an account who they say is under JOHNS name. MARY makes a bank transfer to the account and puts JOHN SMITH as Payee. Because the account number is correct the payment is accepted by the receiving bank. The actual account holder is JOE BLOG. Money is immediately withdrawn. The banks do not reimburse Mary.

attributes.action: Except for MP salary. 100% tax on all other incomes for UK politicians.
attributes.background: Put 100% tax on all external to post income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. Prevent income and/or wealth transfers for a year prior to position. Ban a time offset for potential missed outside earnings. Ban employment post role in associated industry for 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Except for MP salary. Put 100% tax on all income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. 

To discourage people from becoming MPs for financial gain.

To encourage future MPs to consider their country the primary reason for taking a political post.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to exclude Legal Expenses cover against Financial Institutions
attributes.background: Family legal expenses policies commonly sold by insurance companies as an add on for about £30 specifically exclude taking any legal action against any insurance company or bank for any insurance contract, savings, pension or investment policy. This should be outlawed as an unfair contract condition
attributes.additional_details: The insurance industry has created a self protection society to the consumer's detriment. The Government has heavily criticised the FCA and the Ombudsman they created and often reach a decisions different to the law. The consumer is at their mercy as without legal expenses cover they can't afford to take action against arrogant, big boy bully insurance providers who just tell the consumer to go away. These policies are consequently worthless in this regard one of the biggest industries in the UK

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: I want a ban on Guns Knives Machetes Swords and other dangerous items.
attributes.background: Guns Knives Machetes Swords are sold openly at Car Boots Sales. We are in a climate where an attack on civilians could happen at any time and in any area. Legislation should be put in place to prevent this practice from continuing.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: Overhaul the UK 'honours' system so winners are decided by public vote
attributes.background: The recent 'resignation honours' from David Cameron highlights the massively undemocratic way in which honours are handed out - essentially to his friends and those of his wife. The system of 'honours' should be reviewed and overhauled so it operates in a fully democratic way, with a public vote.

attributes.action: Investigate the fiscal soundness of every PFI contract current in the UK.
attributes.background: There is growing concern that the widespread use of PFI by successive Governments may have created a disproportionate financial stress on public services to the detriment of all.  A thorough investigation is therefore warranted.
attributes.additional_details: n/a

attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Take down all "no ball games" signs; children should be outside having fun!
attributes.background: The government needs to review the use of "no ball games" signs throughout the country. We are at a cross-roads, we either allow child obesity to continue at its epidemic rate, or encourage children to play and exercise as much as possible to bring these rates down.

attributes.action: Protect health and pension rights  of British nationals resident in EU states.
attributes.background: The health and pension rights of British citizens living in EU states are protected by reciprocal arrangements (eg, the calculation of a person's pension based on  contributions made in more than one country); these rights must be part of any ageements negotiated during the Brexit process.

attributes.action: Represent remain voters equally within new government leadership framework
attributes.background: 48% of the voting public wanted to remain in the EU, it is unrepresentative and undemocratic that the leaders of our government should stand for a UK polar opposite to what we stand for. Significant Remain Tory representatives should have key roles in the upcoming changes within cabinet.
attributes.additional_details: Young members of voting demographic feel disenfranchised and as though they have unfairly lost out on something they believed in. 48% of the public who voted wish to remain in the EU and do not want a far right, nationalist government. In order for this proportion of the population to feel represented and valued as voters and citizens, those wishing to remain need to be represented equally by senior remain politicians in the new government framework after Cameron's formal resignation.

attributes.action: Call For A 2nd EU Referendum If A Good EU Withdrawal Agreement Cannot Be Made
attributes.background: The United Kingdom voting to leave the European Union triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. We want to decide if we should remain part of the European Union based upon the nature of the withdrawal agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
A Brexit triggers Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty. The European Council will conclude the this withdrawal arrangement based upon a qualified majority vote. A large portion of the United Kingdom electorate were misled into believing a favourable withdrawal agreement is relatively certain. 

We believe in informed democracy. We believe that we the British people should be able to decide whether or not our country leaves the EU based upon facts that we can confirm. Not contingent truths.

attributes.action: Stop Crossrail 2 from destroying Iconic buildings in Wimbledon town.
attributes.background: This will effect so many peoples lives during the construction phase over the next 8-10 years, as buildings, homes and companies are demolished leaving business owners scrambling for new jobs. Wimbledon would also be clogged up with traffic jams. This,ultimately will effect the future of Wimbledon.
attributes.additional_details:
At first I was excited about Crossrail 2, until the government revealed the building being demolished. 

The following are the names of companies/buildings that will be demolished:
Center Court
Waitrose
WHsmith
Tesco
M&S
H&M
Next
Waterstones
Maplins
JD Sports
HMV
O2
Gregs
Lush
Currys PC World
Entertainer
Lakeland
Debanhams
Wimbledon Bridge House
Vodaphone 
Subway
Burger King
British Heart Foundation
Jacks
The Terrace 
Coral1,2 
Jennings Bet
Flight Centre
Doddle
Everyday church
Krystals

attributes.action: Make the Mersey Gateway Bridge free to all Public Transport and Halton Residents
attributes.background: We have been told by George Osborne and David Cameron that we will have all inclusive travel via the Silver Jubilee bridge and the Mersey Gateway Bridge that  free of charge and not based on yearly admin fees which can be viewed as a subscription.
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron came to vist o2 in Runcorn in2015 and he vouched the bridge would be free I heard this straight from the horses mouth and was also documented on North West Tonight.
link as follows from George Osbourne http://www.merseygateway.co.uk/2014/07/chancellor-of-the-exchequer-george-osborne-announces-free-trips-across-both-silver-jubilee-and-mersey-gateway-bridges-for-all-halton-residents/

attributes.action: Every UK pet owner/breeder/pet to be registered or £1000 fine given.
attributes.background: Reduce the number of reported/unreported animal abuse cases via strict registration laws. Owners would need to take their pet to a registration office within a week of getting the animal. Simple DNA sample to be taken from animal. Incentives for people who suspect an animal/owner is not registered.

attributes.action: Make all commuting via public transport tax-deductible.
attributes.background: Give Tax Relief to all commuters who use public transport to travel to and from their permanent place of work.  This would help reduce the cost of living to the average uk citizen and be better for the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The employer buys the ticket and money is removed direct from the employees pay packet before tax is calculated. 
This may encourage less people to use cars which is better for the environment.  It can be managed online to reduce administration costs.

attributes.action: Change disabled parking signs to a D for disabled not a wheelchair
attributes.background: Disabled parking has a stigma attached you have to be in a wheel chair to use them but over 500000 people in the country how other disability where than don't need a wheel chair and are looked at as they should not park in the disabled  bays which is wrong

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: Limit the amount private parking enforcement companies can charge.
attributes.background: Many carparks are monitored by private parking enforcement companies. It is logical to ensure people obey parking rules but they often apply massive fines of £100 for minor parking violations. For many people such high fines cause financial difficulties, this is too high  for minor infractions.
attributes.additional_details: It is of course right to ensure people use carparks fairly and obey the rules. However it is totally unfair that a charge of £100 can be applied for say an overstay of just a few minutes.  For sites where people pay to park I think the limit should be £50 or 5 times the amount of underpayment, whichever is the lower.

attributes.action: Amend the Children Act to allow courts the power to change birth certificates
attributes.background: The government should draft an amendment to the law to allow courts power under the Children Act 1989 to decide in exceptional circumstances if it is in the long term interests of the child to change the child's surname on the birth certificate to reflect a new surname ordered by the courts.
attributes.additional_details:
The law allows a facility for one parent to remove the wrong fathers details from the birth certificate and re-register the birth to include the natural fathers details.

A court can order that a child is to be known by a new surname, but has no power to decide whether that new surname should be reflected on the birth certificate. The other parent's permission is needed for such a change, if this is not gained the wrong father's surname will remain on the entry indefinitely requiring a deed poll.

attributes.action: call for uk prime minister may, to go to parliament & answers for NHS crisis
attributes.background: The British people deserve answers on why our country's greatest asset the NHS is turning the British people away & or leaving them to die in corridors, & it takes Red Cross to call you out don't cut staff & budgets, sort this its our human rights, Pm & government it's your fault not anyone else's
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition for prime minister Theresa May to go to parliament and give answer to the British tax payer and it's people this is a disgrace people are dieing, needlessly under your power and government you have a lot of questions to answer, and don't blame the British public or the staff nurses or doctors, you have made the cuts to staff and hospitals budgets. please get this petition as far as we can as a great country, we're living in 3rd world conditions it's a disgrace. Fund NHS

attributes.action: Senior Ministers should be available to mainstream media during crises...
attributes.background:
With self-evident crises (like the NHS or Southern Rail) the Minister with that brief should be directly answerable. 
I have lost count of the number of times I've heard phrases like 'we asked for a comment but no one was available.'
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly we don't need to interrogate Ministers on their shoes or their trousers (leather or not) - this would be petty. 
When something serious is unfolding, however, they should be immediately available and answerable.
Some Ministers (eg Jeremy Hunt) seem to see their job as some kind of sinecure: not good enough. 
We don't need written statements - they can't be interrogated. Nor a junior sacrificial lamb (eg Chris Philp). We need the Minister with overall responsibility.

attributes.action: Ban or heavily tax makeup which has been tested on animals
attributes.background: I feel animals have a voice which we ignore, we should make a stand to help the animals in their innocence

attributes.action: Glaucoma  patients who need their eye pressure  checked should not be charged.
attributes.background: At present Glaucoma patients can only have their eye pressure tests done once a year covered at NHS cost, if there is a need to monitor the eye pressure to prevent going blind

attributes.action: Assure that the Banbury Horton General Hospital stays open as Oxford is too far!
attributes.background: In writing this as a ambulance practitioner I am solely concerned with patients care as for a seriously ill patient or one in cardiac arrest yo be conveyed from Banbury and surrounding area all the way to Oxford would assuredly kill them we must protect Horton Hospital as a local Banbury resource!!!
attributes.additional_details: See NHS statistics and the resuscitation councils standards for early access in cardiac arrest and cardiac event cases and or cva's/stroke victims time every single second counts

attributes.action: Stop government funding to FA unless it withdraws from FIFA
attributes.background: Folowing on-going coruption allegations and FIFA imposing fines on UK teams for wearing poppies the home nation Football Associations should receive no funding, recognition  or support of any kind from the UK government until they withdraw from FIFA and set up an alternative world cup tournament

attributes.action: Reduce income tax paid on bonus payments
attributes.background:
We work hard to achieve a bonus at work, however the tax that we are paying on bonuses is nearly a third including NI contributions.

Bonuses are achieved by companies and/or individuals doing well in their career and they deserve to earn their full reward for this.

attributes.action: End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a housing crisis and something needs to desperately be done such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
Give Bursaries/reduce restrictions on brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies; This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

That each development must have a specified % of council, affordable,  single-living & various bedroom houses available, so to meet the needs of the whole community.

A law that after a developer has received their planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build.

attributes.action: Stop the time limits on disabled and elderly bus passes.
attributes.background: The rules on a disabled or elderly bus pass is telling people who have them what times they can and can't take a bus journey Its discrimination and absolutely embarrassing to be turned away and declined to take your journey before 9am! Why have the bus pass holders got a bus pass curfew? Fair/Unfair
attributes.additional_details: Contact your local Council and ask for information on times you can use your bus pass. Its like we have to be controlled and they tell us what we can and can't do.

attributes.action: Government should ban competency based interviews.
attributes.background:
The Government should ban competence based interviews as they ignore education, knowledge, skills and past working experience of good candidates and can also be used to discriminate against candidates without detection.

Bring back the old interview system that helped make Britain Great.
attributes.additional_details:
A fair system of scoring candidates should be:
1.	Experience –with proof (25%)
2.	Education- with proof (25%)
3.	Knowledge/ Experience – with proof (25%)
4.	Competencies – through interview (25%)

attributes.action: Parliamentary Election To Take Place 3 Months After Brexit.
attributes.background: Brexit has had huge impact not only on the economy, but has been divisive to the nation/s... for many people both brexiteers and remainers many have lost a lot of faith in the government ability and do not feel the government can take us forward to unite us and recover the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since Brexit, the countries division has been deep routed... And many people feel like their voices are not being heard. The government has been acting unilaterally ignoring a significant number of the population.

This has left very little confidence in the government's ability to fairly treat it's citizens. 

And the only way our voices will be heard is by holding a general election, to lead us in a positive direction and change.

attributes.action: Limit the public use of drones
attributes.background: We believe that the public use of drones is a very real threat to the public and to the community around you. For example there is very easy access to drones and could be used in the wrong way. For example planes have had near misses which could have caused potential threats to the passengers.
attributes.additional_details: I would like greater expansion and enforcement of drone no-fly areas better as serious threats can be caused.There have been cases where drones have been flown into prisons and where drones have been flown over major cities without authorisation which could be potentially life threatening for the public in light of the recent terror attacks in France and Paris. Terrorists could use this equipment. Islamic state already uses drones for surveillance missions and propaganda purposes.

attributes.action: Make cyber bullying/online threats to be recognised as a serious crime.
attributes.background: There are too many people these days taking their own life due to online threats, bullying etc. If you have ever been to the police about online threats they generally will tell you they cannot help and this needs to stop. It needs to be investigated properly, this will lead to lives being saved.
attributes.additional_details:
Online bullying/threats have become a major problem as technology advances, so how many more people need to take their lives before anything changes?

Some facts in the UK about cyber bullying:
There were over 11,000 counselling sessions with young people who talked to Childline about online issues last year
More than 16,000 young people are absent from school due to bullying.
20% of people who experience cyber bullying contemplate suicide, 1 in 10 attempt it.

attributes.action: Review how families are means tested for benefits.
attributes.background:
Why is it only those who do not work or those on low income that get support from the government?

What about those hard working families with a household salary that looks great on paper, who pay thousands in taxes a year, that struggle to afford everyday living costs?
attributes.additional_details:
I personally think there needs to be a complete over-hall in how people are means tested in order to receive benefits and what financial help is made available to all families that struggle regardless of their household income.

My self and my partner on paper have a pretty good household income. Just over £50k a year. However, when you take away costs such as rent/mortgage, utility bills, childcare, travel, food, and everyday living we are left with not much to spare.
